QW-ACT-R1.name: HTML Page has a title
QW-ACT-R1.description: This rule checks that the HTML page has a title.

results.P1: The `title` element exists and it's not empty ('').
results.F1: The `title` element doesn't exist.
results.F2: The `title` element is empty ('').
results.F3: The `title` element is not in the same context.

QW-ACT-R2.name: HTML has lang attribute
QW-ACT-R2.description: This rule checks that the html element has a non-empty lang or xml:lang attribute.

results.P1: The `lang` attribute exists and has a value.
results.F1: The `lang` attribute doesn't exist or is empty ('').

QW-ACT-R3.name: HTML lang and xml:lang match
QW-ACT-R3.description: The rule checks that for the html element, there is no mismatch between the primary language in non-empty lang and xml:lang attributes, if both are used.

results.P1: The `lang` and `xml:lang` attributes have the same value.
results.F1: The `lang` and `xml:lang` attributes don't have the same value.

QW-ACT-R4.name: Meta-refresh no delay
QW-ACT-R4.description: This rule checks that the meta element is not used for delayed redirecting or refreshing.

results.P1: The test target refreshes/redirects immediately.
results.P2: The test target refreshes/redirects after more than 20 hours.
results.F1: The test target refreshes after {seconds} seconds.
results.F2: The test target redirects after {seconds} seconds.

QW-ACT-R5.name: Validity of HTML Lang attribute
QW-ACT-R5.description: This rule checks the lang or xml:lang attribute has a valid language subtag.

results.P1: The `lang` attribute has a valid value.
results.F1: The `lang` attribute does not have a valid value.

QW-ACT-R6.name: Image button has accessible name
QW-ACT-R6.description: This rule checks that each image button element has an accessible name.

results.P1: The test target has an accessible name.
results.F1: The test target doesn't have an accessible name.

QW-ACT-R7.name: Orientation of the page is not restricted using CSS transform property
QW-ACT-R7.description: This rule checks that page content is not restricted to either landscape or portrait orientation using CSS transform property.

results.P1: A page where CSS transform property has rotateZ transform function conditionally applied on the orientation media feature which does not restrict the element to either portrait or landscape orientation.
results.F1: A page where CSS transform property has rotate transform function conditionally applied on the orientation media feature which restricts the element to landscape orientation.

QW-ACT-R9.name: Links with identical accessible names have equivalent purpose
QW-ACT-R9.description: This rule checks that links with identical accessible names resolve to the same resource or equivalent resources.

results.P1: The `links` with the same accessible name have equal content.
results.F1: The `links` with the same accessible name have different content. Verify is the content is equivalent.

QW-ACT-R10.name: `iframe` elements with identical accessible names have equivalent purpose
QW-ACT-R10.description: This rule checks that `iframe` elements with identical accessible names embed the same resource or equivalent resources.

results.P1: The `iframes` with the same accessible name have equal content.
results.F1: The `iframes` with the same accessible name have different content.

QW-ACT-R11.name: Button has accessible name
QW-ACT-R11.description: This rule checks that each button element has an accessible name.

results.P1: The test target has an accessible name.
results.F1: The test target doesn't have an accessible name, or it's empty ('').

QW-ACT-R12.name: Link has accessible name
QW-ACT-R12.description: This rule checks that each link has an accessible name.

results.P1: The test target has an accessible name.
results.F1: The test target doesn't have an accessible name, or it's empty ('').

QW-ACT-R13.name: Element with `aria-hidden` has no focusable content
QW-ACT-R13.description: This rule checks that elements with an aria-hidden attribute do not contain focusable elements.

results.P1: The test target children are not focusable.
results.P2: The test target is not focusable.
results.F1: The test target has focusable children.
results.F2: This test target is focusable.

QW-ACT-R14.name: meta viewport does not prevent zoom
QW-ACT-R14.description: This rule checks that the meta element retains the user agent ability to zoom.

results.P1: The `meta` element with a `name='viewport'` attribute doesn't define the `maximum-scale` and `user-scalable` values.
results.P2: The `meta` element with a `name='viewport'` attribute retains the user agent ability to zoom.
results.F1: The `meta` element with a `name='viewport'` attribute abolishes the user agent ability to zoom with user-scalable=no or maximum-scale < 2.

QW-ACT-R15.name: audio or video has no audio that plays automatically
QW-ACT-R15.description: This rule checks that auto-play audio does not last for more than 3 seconds, or the audio has a control mechanism to stop or mute it.

results.P1: The rule passed because of the rule
results.W1: The rule can't tell because of the rule
results.F1: The rule failed because of the rule

results.P1: The test target has an accessible name.
results.F1: The test target accessible name doesn't exist or it's empty ('').

QW-ACT-R17.name: Image has accessible name
QW-ACT-R17.description: This rule checks that each image that is not marked as decorative, has an accessible name.

results.P1: The test target is decorative.
results.P2: The test target has an accessible name.
results.F1: The test target doesn't have an accessible name.

QW-ACT-R18.name: `id` attribute value is unique
QW-ACT-R18.description: This rule checks that all id attribute values on a single page are unique.

results.P1: The test target has a unique `id` attribute.
results.F1: Several elements have the same `id` attribute.

QW-ACT-R19.name: iframe element has accessible name
QW-ACT-R19.description: This rule checks that each iframe element has an accessible name.

results.P1: The test target has an accessible name.
results.F1: The test target accessible name doesn't exist or it's empty ('').

QW-ACT-R20.name: role attribute has valid value
QW-ACT-R20.description: This rule checks that each role attribute has a valid value.

results.P1: The test target has a valid `role` attribute.
results.F1: The test target has an invalid `role` attribute.

QW-ACT-R21.name: svg element with explicit role has accessible name
QW-ACT-R21.description: This rule checks that each SVG image element that is explicitly included in the accessibility tree has an accessible name.

results.P1: The test target has an accessible name.
results.F1: The test target accessible name doesn't exist or it's empty ('').

QW-ACT-R22.name: Element within body has valid lang attribute
QW-ACT-R22.description: This rule checks that the lang attribute of an element in the page body has a valid primary language subtag.

results.P1: The test target has a valid `lang` attribute.
results.F1: The test target has an invalid `lang` attribute.

QW-ACT-R23.name: video element visual content has accessible alternative
QW-ACT-R23.description: This rule checks that video elements with audio have an alternative for the video content as audio or as text.

results.P1: The rule passed because of the rule
results.W1: The rule can't tell because of the rule
results.F1: The rule failed because of the rule

QW-ACT-R24.name: autocomplete attribute has valid value
QW-ACT-R24.description: This rule checks that the HTML autocomplete attribute has a correct value.

results.P1: The test target has a valid `autocomplete` attribute.
results.F1: The test target `autocomplete` attribute is not valid.

QW-ACT-R25.name: ARIA state or property is permitted
QW-ACT-R25.description: This rule checks that WAI-ARIA states or properties are allowed for the element they are specified on.

results.P1: The `{attr}` property is supported or inherited by the `role` {role}.
results.F1: The `{attr}` property is neither inherited nor supported by the `role` {role}.

QW-ACT-R26.name: video element auditory content has accessible alternative
QW-ACT-R26.description: This rule checks that video elements have an alternative for information conveyed through audio.

results.P1: The rule passed because of the rule
results.W1: The rule can't tell because of the rule
results.F1: The rule failed because of the rule

QW-ACT-R27.name: aria-* attribute is defined in WAI-ARIA
QW-ACT-R27.description: This rule checks that each aria-* attribute specified is defined in ARIA 1.1.

results.P1: All aria-* attributes in this element are defined in ARIA 1.1.
results.F1: One or more aria-* attributes are not defined in ARIA 1.1.

QW-ACT-R28.name: Element with role attribute has required states and properties
QW-ACT-R28.description: This rule checks that elements that have an explicit role also specify all required states and properties.

results.P1: The test target required attributes are listed.
results.P2: The test target `role` doesn't have required state or property
results.F1: The test target has unlisted required states or properties.

QW-ACT-R29.name: Audio element content has text alternative
QW-ACT-R29.description: This rule checks if audio only elements have a text alternative available.

results.P1: The rule passed because of the rule
results.W1: The rule can't tell because of the rule
results.F1: The rule failed because of the rule

QW-ACT-R30.name: Visible label is part of accessible name
QW-ACT-R30.description: This rule checks that interactive elements labeled through their content have their visible label as part of their accessible name.

results.P1: The complete visible text content of the test target either matches or is contained within its accessible name.
results.F1: The test target doesn't have an accessible name.
results.F2: The complete visible text content of the test target neither matches or is contained within its accessible name.

QW-ACT-R31.name: Video element visual-only content has accessible alternative
QW-ACT-R31.description: This rule checks that video elements without audio have an alternative available.

results.P1: The rule passed because of the rule
results.W1: The rule can't tell because of the rule
results.F1: The rule failed because of the rule

QW-ACT-R32.name: video element visual content has strict accessible alternative
QW-ACT-R32.description: This rule checks that video elements with audio have audio description.

results.P1: The rule passed because of the rule
results.W1: The rule can't tell because of the rule
results.F1: The rule failed because of the rule

QW-ACT-R33.name: ARIA required context role
QW-ACT-R33.description: This rule checks that an element with an explicit semantic role exists inside its required context.

results.P1: The test target parent has the required context `role`.
results.F1: The test target parent doesn't have the required context `role`.

QW-ACT-R34.name: ARIA state or property has valid value
QW-ACT-R34.description: This rule checks that each ARIA state or property has a valid value.

results.P1: The test target `{attr}` attribute has a valid value.
results.F1: The test target `{attr}` attribute has an invalid value.

QW-ACT-R35.name: Heading has accessible name
QW-ACT-R35.description: This rule applies to any HTML element with the semantic role of heading that is included in the accessibility tree.

results.P1: The test target has a non-empty accessible name.
results.F1: The test target accessible name doesn't exist or it's empty ('').

QW-ACT-R36.name: Headers attribute specified on a cell refers to cells in the same table element
QW-ACT-R36.description: This rule checks that the headers attribute on a cell refer to other cells in the same table element with a semantic role of columnheader or rowheader.

results.P1: All headers attributes refer to a cell with a semantic role of columnheader of rowheader within the same table.
results.F1: The headers attribute `{attr}` refers to an ID that does not exist within the same table.
results.F2: The headers attribute `{attr}` refers to an element inside the same table which does not have a role of rowheader or columnheader.

QW-ACT-R37.name: Text has minimum contrast
QW-ACT-R37.description: This rule checks that the highest possible contrast of every text character with its background meets the minimal contrast requirement.

results.P1: Element has contrast ratio higher than minimum.
results.P2: Element doesn't have human language text.
results.P3: Element has gradient with contrast ratio higher than minimum.
results.W1: Element has text-shadow that needs manual verification.
results.W2: Element has an image on background.
results.W3: Element has an gradient that we can't verify.
results.F1: Element has contrast ratio lower than minimum.
results.F2: Element has gradient with contrast ratio lower than minimum.

QW-ACT-R38.name: ARIA required owned elements
QW-ACT-R38.description: This rule checks that an element with an explicit semantic role has at least one of its required owned elements.

results.P1: The test target only owns elements with correct role.
results.F1: The test target owns elements that doesn't have the correct role.

QW-ACT-R39.name: All table header cells have assigned data cells
QW-ACT-R39.description: This rule checks that each table header has assigned data cells in a table element.

results.P1: The column header element has at least one assigned cell.
results.F1: The column header element does not have at least one assigned cell.

QW-ACT-R40.name: Zoomed text node is not clipped with CSS overflow
QW-ACT-R40.description: This rule checks that text nodes are not unintentionally clipped by overflow, when a page is zoomed to 200% on 1280 by 1024 viewport.

results.W1: Check if each ancestor or the text node is not clipped by overflow.

QW-ACT-R41.name: Error message describes invalid form field value
QW-ACT-R41.description: This rule checks that text error messages provided when the user completes a form field with invalid values or using an invalid format, identify the cause of the error or how to fix the error.

results.W1: Check that text error messages provided, identify the cause of the error or how to fix the error.

QW-ACT-R42.name: Object element has non-empty accessible name
QW-ACT-R42.description: This rule checks that each `object` element has a non-empty accessible name.

results.P1: The test target has a non-empty accessible name.
results.F1: The test target accessible name doesn't exist or it's empty ('').

QW-ACT-R43.name: Scrollable element is keyboard accessible
QW-ACT-R43.description: This rule checks that scrollable elements can be scrolled by keyboard

results.P1: This scrollable section element is included in sequential focus navigation.
results.F1: This vertically/horizontally scrollable section element is not included in sequential focus navigation, nor does it have any descendants that are.

QW-ACT-R44.name: Links with identical accessible names and context serve equivalent purpose
QW-ACT-R44.description: This rule checks that links with identical accessible names and context resolve to the same or equivalent resources.

results.P1: The `links` with the same accessible name have equal content.
results.W1: The `links` with the same accessible name have different content. Verify is the content is equivalent.

QW-ACT-R48.name: Element marked as decorative is not exposed
QW-ACT-R48.description: This rule checks that elements marked as decorative either are not included in the accessibility tree, or have a presentational role.

results.P1: The test target is not in the accessibility tree.
results.F1: The test target is in the accessibility tree.

QW-ACT-R49.name: Audio or video that plays automatically has no audio that lasts more than 3 seconds
QW-ACT-R49.description: audio or video that plays automatically does not output audio for more than 3 seconds.

results.P1: The test target plays for 3 seconds or less.
results.W1: Can't collect data from the test target element.
results.W2: Check if test target has a visible control mechanism.

QW-ACT-R50.name: audio or video that plays automatically has a control mechanism
QW-ACT-R50.description: audio or video that plays automatically must have a control mechanism.

results.P1: The test target has a visible control mechanism.
results.W1: Can't collect data from the test target element.
results.W2: Check if test target has a visible control mechanism.

QW-ACT-R51.name: video element visual-only content is media alternative for text
QW-ACT-R51.description: This rule checks non-streaming silent video is a media alternative for text on the page.

results.W1: Can't collect data from the test target.
results.W2: Check that the content in the video matches the information in the text.

QW-ACT-R52.name: video element visual-only content has description track
QW-ACT-R52.description: This rule checks that description tracks that come with non-streaming video elements, without audio, are descriptive.

results.W1: Can't collect data from the test target.
results.W2: Check if visual content has an accessible alternative.

QW-ACT-R53.name: video element visual-only content has transcript
QW-ACT-R53.description: Non-streaming video elements without audio must have all visual information available in a transcript.

results.W1: Can't collect data from the test target.
results.W2: Check if visual content has an accessible alternative.

QW-ACT-R54.name: video element visual-only content has audio track alternative
QW-ACT-R54.description: Non-streaming video elements without audio must have an audio alternative.

results.W1: Can't collect data from the test target.
results.W2: Check if visual content has an accessible alternative.

QW-ACT-R55.name: video element visual content has audio description
QW-ACT-R55.description: This rule checks that non-streaming video elements have all visual information also contained in the audio.

results.W1: Can't collect data from the test target.
results.W2: The test target has a sound track but we can't verify the volume. Check if the test target has audio and if it does check if visual content has an accessible alternative.

QW-ACT-R56.name: video element content is media alternative for text
QW-ACT-R56.description: This rule checks non-streaming video is a media alternative for text on the page.

results.W1: Can't collect data from the test target.
results.W2: Check that the content in the video matches the information in the text.

QW-ACT-R57.name: video element visual content has description track
QW-ACT-R57.description: This rule checks that description tracks that come with non-streaming video elements are descriptive.

results.W1: Can't collect data from the test target.
results.W2: The test target has a sound track but we can't verify the volume. Check if the test target has audio and if it does check if visual content has an accessible alternative.

QW-ACT-R58.name: audio element content has transcript
QW-ACT-R58.description: Non-streaming audio elements must have a text alternative for all included auditory information.

results.W1: Check if the test target audio has text-alternative.

QW-ACT-R59.name: audio element content is media alternative for text
QW-ACT-R59.description: This rule checks audio is a media alternative for text on the page.

results.W1: Check that the content in the audio matches the information in the text.

QW-ACT-R60.name: video element auditory content has captions
QW-ACT-R60.description: This rule checks that captions are available for audio information in non-streaming video elements.

results.W1: Can't collect data from the test target.
results.W2: The test target has a sound track but we can't verify the volume. Check if the test target has audio and if it does check if audio content has matching captions.

QW-ACT-R61.name: Audio and visuals of video element have transcript
QW-ACT-R61.description: This rule checks that non-streaming video elements have all audio and visual information available in a transcript.

results.W1: Can't collect data from the test target.
results.W2: The test target has a sound track but we can't verify the volume. Check if the test target has audio and a transcript. If it does check if the transcript contains all the visual and audio information of the video.

QW-ACT-R62.name: Element in sequential focus order has visible focus
QW-ACT-R62.description: This rule checks that each element in sequential focus order has some visible focus indication.

results.W1: Check if the element has some visible focus indication

QW-ACT-R63.name: Document has a landmark with non-repeated content
QW-ACT-R63.description: This rule checks that each page has an element with a landmark semantic role starting with non-repeated content

results.P1: The page doesn't have repeated content.
results.W1: Check either there is no non-repeated content after repeated content or there exists an element for which all the following are true: - the element has semantic role inheriting from landmark; and - the first perceivable content (in tree order in the flat tree) which is an inclusive descendant of the element is non-repeated content after repeated content; and - the element is included in the accessibility tree.

QW-ACT-R64.name: Document has heading for non-repeated content
QW-ACT-R64.description: This rule checks that the non-repeated content contains a heading

results.P1: The page doesn't have repeated content.
results.W1: Check either there is no non-repeated content after repeated content or there exists an element for which all the following are true: - the element is non-repeated content after repeated content; and - the element has a semantic role of heading; and - the element is visible; and - the element is included in the accessibility tree.

QW-ACT-R65.name: Element with presentational children has no focusable content
QW-ACT-R65.description: This rule checks that elements with a role that makes its children presentational do not contain focusable elements.

results.P1: The element doesn't have descendants in the flat tree that are part of sequential focus navigation.
results.F1: The element has descendants in the flat tree that are part of sequential focus navigation.

QW-ACT-R66.name: Menuitem has non-empty accessible name
QW-ACT-R66.description: This rule checks that each element with a menuitem role has a non-empty accessible name.

results.P1: The test target has a non-empty accessible name.
results.F1: The test target accessible name doesn't exist or it's empty ('').

QW-ACT-R67.name: Letter spacing in style attributes is not !important
QW-ACT-R67.description: This rule checks that the style attribute is not used to prevent adjusting letter-spacing by using !important, except if it's at least 0.12 times the font size.

results.P1: The letter-spacing property is not !important.
results.P2: The letter-spacing is at least 0.12 times the font-size.
results.P3: The cascaded letter-spacing is not the declared value.
results.F1: CSS styles prevent the letter-spacing to be above the minimum value.

QW-ACT-R68.name: Line height in style attributes is not !important
QW-ACT-R68.description: This rule checks that the style attribute is not used to prevent adjusting line-height by using !important, except if it's at least 1.5 times the font size.

results.P1: The line-height property is not !important.
results.P2: The line-height is at least 1.5 times the font-size.
results.P3: The cascaded line-height is not the declared value.
results.F1: CSS styles prevent the line-height to be above the minimum value.

QW-ACT-R69.name: Word spacing in style attributes is not !important
QW-ACT-R69.description: This rule checks that the style attribute is not used to prevent adjusting word-spacing by using !important, except if it's at least 0.16 times the font size.

results.P1: The word-spacing property is not !important.
results.P2: The word-spacing is at least 0.16 times the font-size.
results.P3: The cascaded word-spacing is not the declared value.
results.F1: CSS styles prevent the word-spacing to be above the minimum value.

QW-ACT-R70.name: iframe with negative tabindex has no interactive elements
QW-ACT-R70.description: This rule checks that `iframe` elements with a negative `tabindex` attribute value contain no interactive elements.

results.P1: The nested browsing context does not include elements that are visible and part of the sequential focus navigation.
results.F1: The nested browsing context includes elements that are visible and part of the sequential focus navigation.

QW-ACT-R71.name: `meta` element has no refresh delay (no exception)
QW-ACT-R71.description: This rule checks that the `meta` element is not used for delayed redirecting or refreshing.

results.P1: The test target refreshes/redirects immediately.
results.F1: The test target refreshes after {seconds} seconds.
results.F2: The test target redirects after {seconds} seconds.

QW-ACT-R72.name: First focusable element is link to non-repeated content
QW-ACT-R72.description: This rule checks that the first focusable element is a link to non-repeated content in the page

results.W1: Check that the first focusable element has an accessible name that communicates that it skips content
results.W2: Check that the first focusable element skips to the main content and its accessible name communicates so.
results.F1: The first focusable element is not keyboard actionable.
results.F2: The first focusable element is not in the accessibility tree.
results.F3: The first focusable element does not have the role of link.
results.F4: The first focusable element does not skip to the main content.
results.F5: The page does not have focusable elements.

QW-ACT-R73.name: Block of repeated content is collapsible
QW-ACT-R73.description: This rule checks that repeated blocks of content are collapsible.

results.P1: The page doesn't have repeated content.
results.W1: For each block of repeated content in each test target, which is before (in the flat tree) at least one node of non-repeated content after repeated content, check that all the following are true: - there exists an instrument to make all nodes in this block not visible; and - there exists an instrument to remove all nodes in this block from the accessibility tree.

QW-ACT-R74.name: Document has an instrument to move focus to non-repeated content
QW-ACT-R74.description: This rule checks that there is an instrument to move focus to non-repeated content in the page.

results.P1: The page doesn't have repeated content.
results.W1: The page has one or more instrument(s) to move focus. Check if any of these instrument(s) is being used before a block of repeated content, and the focus is moved to just before a block of non-repeated content.
results.W2: Check if the page has any instrument(s) to move focus. Check if any of these instrument(s) is being used before a block of repeated content, and the focus is moved to just before a block of non-repeated content.

QW-ACT-R75.name: Bypass Blocks of Repeated Content
QW-ACT-R75.description: This rule checks that each page has a mechanism to bypass repeated blocks of content.

results.P1: The rule passed because of the rule
results.W1: The rule can't tell because of the rule
results.F1: The rule failed because of the rule

QW-ACT-R76.name: Text has enhanced contrast
QW-ACT-R76.description: This rule checks that the highest possible contrast of every text character with its background meets the enhanced contrast requirement.

results.P1: Element has contrast ratio higher than minimum.
results.P2: Element doesn't have human language text.
results.P3: Element has gradient with contrast ratio higher than minimum.
results.W1: Element has text-shadow that needs manual verification.
results.W2: Element has an image on background.
results.W3: Element has an gradient that we can't verify.
results.F1: Element has contrast ratio lower than minimum.
results.F2: Element has gradient with contrast ratio lower than minimum.

QW-WCAG-T1.name: Providing text alternatives for the area elements of image maps
QW-WCAG-T1.description: This technique checks the text alternative of area elements of images maps

results.W1: Please verify that the `alt` attribute describes correctly the corresponding area of the image.
results.F1: The `alt` attribute doesn't exist or is empty ('').

QW-WCAG-T2.name: Using caption elements to associate data table captions with data tables
QW-WCAG-T2.description: This technique checks the caption element is correctly use on tables

results.W1: Please verify that the `caption` element identifies the table correctly.
results.F1: The `caption` element doesn't exist or is empty ('').

QW-WCAG-T3.name: Providing a description for groups of form controls using `fieldset` and `legend` elements
QW-WCAG-T3.description: This technique checks the correct use of the description element for form controls

results.W1: Please verify that the `legend` description is valid.
results.F1: The `fieldset` element is neither inside nor referencing a `form` element.
results.F2: The `legend` element doesn't exist or is empty ('').

QW-WCAG-T4.name: Using the summary attribute of the table element to give an overview of data tables
QW-WCAG-T4.description: This technique checks the correct use of the summary attribute for table elements

results.W1: Please verify that the summary is a valid description of the table.
results.F1: The summary is empty.
results.F2: The caption is a duplicate of the summary.

QW-WCAG-T5.name: Using alt attributes on images used as submit buttons
QW-WCAG-T5.description: This technique checks all input elements that are buttons use alt text

results.W1: Please verify that the value of the alt attribute correctly describes the function of the button.
results.F1: The input element does not have an alt attribute.
results.F2: The input element has an empty alt attribute.

QW-WCAG-T6.name: Using both keyboard and other device-specific functions
QW-WCAG-T6.description: The objective of this technique is to verify the parity of keyboard-specific and mouse-specific events when code that has a scripting function associated with an event is used

results.P1: The mouse event attribute has a keyboard equivalent.
results.W1: The test target has a keyboard event, but we can't verify if it's equivalent to the mouse event.

QW-WCAG-T7.name: Providing definitions for abbreviations by using the abbr element
QW-WCAG-T7.description: The objective of this technique is to provide expansions or definitions for abbreviations by using the abbr element

results.P1: The test target has the definition in the title attribute.
results.F1: The test target doesn't have the definition in the title attribute.

QW-WCAG-T8.name: Failure of Success Criterion 1.1.1 and 1.2.1 due to using text alternatives that are not alternatives
QW-WCAG-T8.description: This describes a failure condition for all techniques involving text alternatives. If the text in the "text alternative" cannot be used in place of the non-text content without losing information or function then it fails because it is not, in fact, an alternative to the non-text content

results.W1: Text alternative needs manual verification.
results.F1: Text alternative is not actually a text alternative for the non-text content.

QW-WCAG-T9.name: Organizing a page using headings
QW-WCAG-T9.description: The objective of this technique is to ensure that sections have headings that identify them and that the heading are used in the correct order

results.W1: Please verify that headers are used to divide the page correctly.
results.F1: Headings are not in the correct order.
results.F2: Heading number is missing.

QW-WCAG-T10.name: Combining adjacent image and text links for the same resource
QW-WCAG-T10.description: The objective of this technique is to provide both text and iconic representations of links without making the web page more confusing or difficult for keyboard users or assistive technology users. Since different users finding text and icons more usable, providing both can improve the accessibility of the link.

results.P1: The a element contains an image that has an empty alt attribute.
results.W1: The link contains an image that has an alt attribute that should be manually verified.
results.F1: The link text is equal to the image's alternative text.

QW-WCAG-T11.name: Providing text alternatives on applet elements
QW-WCAG-T11.description: Provide a text alternative for an applet by using the alt attribute to label an applet and providing the text alternative in the body of the applet element. In this technique, both mechanisms are required due to the varying support of the alt attribute and applet body text by user agents.

results.W1: Please verify that the values of the alt attribute and the body text correctly describe the applet element.
results.F1: The applet element does not contain an alt attribute.
results.F2: The applet element has an empty alt attribute.
results.F3: The applet element does not contain alternative text in its body.

QW-WCAG-T12.name: Failure of Success Criterion 1.3.1 due to using th elements, caption elements, or non-empty summary attributes in layout tables
QW-WCAG-T12.description: The objective of this technique is to describe a failure that occurs when a table used only for layout includes either th elements, a summary attribute, or a caption element. This is a failure because it uses structural (or semantic) markup only for presentation. The intent of the HTML and XHTML table elements is to present data.

results.W1: No incorrect elements used in layout table.
results.F1: The table has a non-empty summary - Amend it if it's a layout table.
results.F2: The table has a th element - Amend it if it's a layout table.
results.F3: The table has a caption element - Amend it if it's a layout table.

QW-WCAG-T13.name: Failure of Success Criterion 2.2.2 due to using the blink element
QW-WCAG-T13.description: The blink element, while not part of the official HTML or XHTML specification, is supported by many user agents. It causes any text inside the element to blink at a predetermined rate. This cannot be interrupted by the user, nor can it be disabled as a preference. The blinking continues as long as the page is displayed. Therefore, content that uses blink fails the Success Criterion because blinking can continue for more than three seconds.

results.P1: Blink is not used.
results.F1: Used blink element.

QW-WCAG-T14.name: Using id and headers attributes to associate data cells with header cells in data tables
QW-WCAG-T14.description: This technique checks if data cells are associated with header cells in data tables.

results.I2: This table is a layout table.
results.I3: No header attributes are used in this data table.
results.P1: id and headers attributes are correctly used.
results.F1: This table is a layout table with id or headers attributes.
results.F2: There are duplicate `id`s in this data table.
results.F3: id and headers attributes are not correctly used.

QW-WCAG-T15.name: Using the link element and navigation tools
QW-WCAG-T15.description: The objective of this technique is to describe how the link element can provide metadata about the position of an HTML page within a set of Web pages or can assist in locating content with a set of Web pages.

results.I2: The element doesn't contain a rel attribute or doesn't pertains navigation.
results.P1: The link has rel and href attributes and pertains navigation.
results.F1: The element doesn't contain an href attribute and pertains navigation.

QW-WCAG-T16.name: Using HTML according to spec
QW-WCAG-T16.description: This technique checks that the HTML or XHTML web page follows the specification.

results.P1: The HTML document doesn't have errors.
results.W1: The HTML document has warnings.
results.F1: The HTML document has errors.

QW-WCAG-T17.name: Positioning labels to maximize predictability of relationships
QW-WCAG-T17.description: This technique checks the correct position of labels in forms

results.P1: The form field has well positioned label.
results.F1: The form field has incorrect positioned label.
results.F2: The form field label is empty.
results.F3: The form field label is not visible.

QW-WCAG-T18.name: Using table markup to present tabular information
QW-WCAG-T18.description: The objective of this technique is to present tabular information in a way that preserves relationships within the information even when users cannot see the table or the presentation format is changed. Using the table element with the child elements tr, th, and td makes these relationships perceivable.

results.P1: There is at least one occurrence of table, tr, td and th.
results.F1: There are missing table child elements.

QW-WCAG-T19.name: Providing submit buttons
QW-WCAG-T19.description: The objective of this technique is to provide a mechanism that allows users to explicitly request changes of context. The intended use of a submit button is to generate an HTTP request that submits data entered in a form, so it is an appropriate control to use for causing a change of context.

results.P1: The form contains one of the following elements input[type~='submit image'], button[type='submit'].
results.F1: Form tag doesn't contain any of the following elements input[type~='submit image'], button[type='submit'].

QW-WCAG-T20.name: Supplementing link text with the title attribute
QW-WCAG-T20.description: Supplementing link text with the title attribute

results.W1: Please verify that the element's title attribute describes correctly the link.
results.F1: The element's title attribute is empty.
results.F2: The element contains a title attribute equal to the text in the link

QW-WCAG-T21.name: Failure of Success Criteria 2.4.4, 2.4.9 and 4.1.2 due to not providing an accessible name for an image which is the only content in a link
QW-WCAG-T21.description: This technique checks the text alternative of images which are the only content of a link

results.P1: The link has an accessible name.
results.F1: The image doesn't have an accessible name.

QW-WCAG-T22.name: Failure of Success Criterion 3.2.1 and 3.2.5 due to opening a new window as soon as a new page is loaded
QW-WCAG-T22.description: The objective of this technique is to ensure that pages do not disorient users by opening up one or more new windows that automatically attain focus as soon as a page is loaded.

results.P1: Browser didn't open new tab.
results.F1: Browser opened a new tab.

QW-WCAG-T23.name: Adding a link at the top of each page that goes directly to the main content area
QW-WCAG-T23.description: The objective of this technique is to provide a mechanism to bypass blocks of material that are repeated on multiple Web pages by skipping directly to the main content of the Web page.

results.W1: The first focusable control is a visible link to a <main> element.
results.W2: The first focusable control is a visible link to some content in the Web Page. Verify if it links to the main content.
results.F1: The first focusable control on the Web page links to an inexistent element.
results.F2: The first focusable control on the Web page links to the top of the page.
results.F3: The first focusable control on the Web page does not links to local content.
results.F4: The first focusable control on the Web page is not a link.
results.F5: This Web page does not have focusable controls.

QW-WCAG-T24.name: Failure of Success Criteria 2.1.1, 2.4.7, and 3.2.1 due to using script to remove focus when focus is received
QW-WCAG-T24.description: Content that normally receives focus when the content is accessed by keyboard may have this focus removed by scripting.

results.P1: Element kept focus.
results.F1: Element didn't keep focus.

QW-WCAG-T25.name: Using the scope attribute to associate header cells and data cells in data tables
QW-WCAG-T25.description: The objective of this technique is to associate header cells with data cells in complex tables using the scope attribute.

results.P1: The element's scope attribute matches the following values: col, row, colgroup, rowgroup.
results.F1: The element doesn't contain a scope attribute.
results.F2: The element's scope attribute is empty.
results.F3: The element's scope attribute doesn't match any of the following values: col, row, colgroup, rowgroup.

QW-WCAG-T26.name: Failure of Success Criterion 4.1.2 due to using script to make div or span a user interface control in HTML without providing a role for the control
QW-WCAG-T26.description: This failure demonstrates how using generic HTML elements to create user interface controls can make the controls inaccessible to assistive technology.

results.P1: The element is a user interface control with an event handler.
results.F1: The element is a forced user interface control without the proper role attribute.

QW-WCAG-T27.name: Failure of Success Criterion 1.4.8 due to using text that is justified (aligned to both the left and the right margins)
QW-WCAG-T27.description: This failure describes situations where blocks of text that are justified (aligned to both the left and the right margins) occurs in HTML, using the 'align' attribute.

results.P1: This content is not justified.
results.F1: This content shouldn't be justified.

QW-WCAG-T28.name: Using `percent, em, names` for font sizes
QW-WCAG-T28.description: This technique checks that all font-size attribute uses percent, em or names.

results.P1: This test target has a font-size css property using an relative unit value with the important flag.
results.F1: This test target has a font-size css property using an absolute unit value with the important flag.

QW-WCAG-T29.name: Specifying alignment either to the left or right in CSS
QW-WCAG-T29.description: This technique describes how to align blocks of text either left or right by setting the CSS text-align property.

results.P1: This test target has a text-align css property equal to justify.
results.F1: This test target has a text-align css property not equal to justify.

QW-WCAG-T30.name: Failure of Success Criterion 2.2.2 due to using text-decoration:blink without a mechanism to stop it in less than five seconds
QW-WCAG-T30.description: CSS defines the blink value for the text-decoration property. When used, it causes any text in elements with this property to blink at a predetermined rate. This cannot be interrupted by the user, nor can it be disabled as a user agent preference. The blinking continues as long as the page is displayed. Therefore, content that uses text-decoration:blink fails the Success Criterion because blinking can continue for more than three seconds.

results.F1: This test target has a `text-decoration` property with the value `blink.

QW-WCAG-T31.name: Failure of Success Criterion 1.4.3, 1.4.6 and 1.4.8 due to specifying foreground colors without specifying background colors or vice versa
QW-WCAG-T31.description: Users with vision loss or cognitive, language and learning challenges often prefer specific foreground and background color combinations. In some cases, individuals with low vision will find it much easier to see a Web page that has white text on a black background, and they may have set their user agent to present this contrast. Many user agents make it possible for users to choose a preference about the foreground or background colors they would like to see without overriding all author-specified styles. This makes it possible for users to view pages where colors have not been specified by the author in their preferred color combination.

results.P1: The test target has a author defined color and background css properties.
results.F1: The test target has a author defined color css property but not a background css property.
results.F2: The test target has a author defined background property but not a color css property.

QW-WCAG-T32.name: Using ol, ul and dl for lists or groups of links
QW-WCAG-T32.description: The objective of this technique is to create lists of related items using list elements appropriate for their purposes.

results.W1: Check that content that has the visual appearance of a list (with or without bullets) is marked as an unordered list.
results.W2: Check that content that has the visual appearance of a numbered list is marked as an ordered list.
results.W3: Check that content is marked as a definition list when terms and their definitions are presented in the form of a list.
results.F1: A list item is not contained in a correct list element.

QW-WCAG-T33.name: Using description lists - dd,dt
QW-WCAG-T33.description: Ensures <dt> and <dd> elements are contained by a <dl>

results.P1: The test target is contained in a correct description list element.
results.F1: The test target is not contained in a correct description list element.

QW-WCAG-T34.name: Using description lists - dl
QW-WCAG-T34.description: Ensures <dl> elements are structured correctly. <dl> elements must only directly contain properly-ordered <dt> and <dd> groups, <script>, <template> or <div> elements

results.P1: The description list element is structured correctly
results.F1: The description list element contains an incorrect element type
results.F2: The description list element is not ordered correctly

QW-BP1.name: Using h1-h6 to identify headings
QW-BP1.description: It is recommended to use HTML and XHTML heading markup to provide semantic code for headings in the content

results.W1: Check that heading markup is used when content is a heading.
results.F1: This page doesn't use headings.

QW-BP2.name: Concise images alt text
QW-BP2.description: Image alt text attribute with more than 100 characters

results.P1: The img alt text attribute has less than 100 characters.
results.F1: The img alt text attribute has more than 100 characters.

QW-BP4.name: Grouped links not within a nav element
QW-BP4.description: Set of 10 or more links not grouped within a list (nav)

results.F1: It was found a group of 10 or more links not grouped within a nav element.

QW-BP5.name: Using table elements inside other table elements
QW-BP5.description: It is not recommended to use table elements inside other table elements

results.P1: There are not table elements inside other table elements.
results.F1: There are table elements inside other table elements

QW-BP6.name: title element is not too long (100 characters)
QW-BP6.description: The webpage title element shouldn't have more than 100 characters

results.P1: The page title has less than 100 characters.
results.F1: The page title has 100 or more characters.

results.P1: The title element doesn't contain ASCII art.
results.F1: The title element contains ASCII art.

QW-BP8.name: Headings with images should have an accessible name
QW-BP8.description: Headings with at least one image should have an accessible name

results.P1: This heading with at least one image has an accessible name.
results.F1: This heading with at least one image does not have an accessible name.

QW-BP9.name: Table element without header cells has a caption
QW-BP9.description: A table without th elements should have a caption element to describe it.

results.P1: Table doesn't have header cells but has a caption.
results.F1: Table doesn't have header cells or caption.

QW-BP10.name: HTML elements are used to control visual presentation of content
QW-BP10.description: No HTML elements are used to control the visual presentation of content

results.P1: The webpage doesn't use elements to control the visual content presentation.
results.F1: The webpage uses the element {name} to control the visual content presentation.

QW-BP11.name: Using br to make a list

results.P1: There are less than 3 consecutive br.
results.F1: `br` elements are being be used as a list.

QW-BP12.name: Using scope col and row
QW-BP12.description: Using scope col in the first row and scope row in the first element of each row

results.P1: The scope attribute is correctly used.
results.F1: The scope attribute is incorrectly used.

QW-BP13.name: Using consecutive links with the same href and one contains an image
QW-BP13.description: Using consecutive links with the same href in which one of the links contains an image

results.P1: There are no consecutive links with the same href in which one of the links contained an image.
results.F1: There are consecutive links with the same href in which one of the links contained an image.

QW-BP15.name: At least one width attribute of an HTML element is expressed in absolute values
QW-BP15.description: At least one width attribute of an HTML element is expressed in absolute values

results.P1: The test target `width` attribute uses relative units.
results.F1: The test target `width` attribute uses absolute units.

QW-BP17.name: Adding a link at the beginning of a block of repeated content to go to the end of the block
QW-BP17.description: The objective of this technique is to provide a mechanism to bypass a block of material by skipping to the end of the block.

results.W1: This link skips a content block.
results.F1: This page does not have links.

QW-BP18.name: Using percentage values in CSS for container sizes
QW-BP18.description: The objective of this technique is to enable users to increase the size of text without having to scroll horizontally to read that text. To use this technique, an author specifies the width of text containers using percent values.

results.P1: This test target has a `width` css property using percentage value with the important flag.
results.F1: This test target has a `width` css property using `px` value with the important flag.
results.F2: This test target has a `width` css property not using percentage value with the important flag.

QW-BP19.name: Landmark banner is top level
QW-BP19.description: Ensures the banner landmark is at top level

results.P1: The banner landmark is at top level.
results.F1: The banner landmark is not at top level.

QW-BP20.name: Landmark no duplicate banner
QW-BP20.description: Ensures the document has at most one banner landmark

results.P1: There is one banner landmark
results.F1: There are multiple banner landmarks

QW-BP21.name: Landmark no duplicate contentinfo
QW-BP21.description: Ensures the document has at most one contentinfo landmark

results.P1: There is one contentinfo landmark
results.F1: There are multiple banner landmarks

QW-BP22.name: Landmark has one main
QW-BP22.description: Ensures the document has a main landmark

results.P1: There is one main landmark.
results.F1: There are multiple main landmarks.

results.P1: Listitem is used semantically
results.F1: Listitem is not used semantically not used semantically

QW-BP24.name: Lists are used correctly
QW-BP24.description: Ensures that lists are structured correctly. <ul> and <ol> must only directly contain <li>, <script> or <template> elements

results.P1: List is used correctly
results.F1: List is not used correctly

QW-BP25.name: Landmark complementary is top level
QW-BP25.description: Ensures the complementary landmark or aside is at top level

results.P1: The complementary landmark is at top level.
results.F1: The complementary landmark is not at top level.

QW-BP26.name: Landmark complementary is top level
QW-BP26.description: Ensures the contentinfo landmark is at top level

results.P1: The complementary landmark is at top level.
results.F1: The complementary landmark is not at top level.

QW-BP27.name: Landmark main is top level
QW-BP27.description: Ensures the main landmark is at top level

results.P1: The main landmark is at top level.
results.F1: The main landmark is not at top level.

QW-BP28.name: H1 element is used and unique
QW-BP28.description: Ensures there is only one H1

results.P1: The H1 element is used and unique
results.F1: The H1 element is not present or used more than one time
